intro: Psychotria xanthochlora, commonly known as the yellow-leaved psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its vibrant yellow leaves, which contrast with its dark green stems and small, white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
